Uses of Class
com.appglu.android.sync.SyncIntentServiceRequest

Packages that use SyncIntentServiceRequest
com.appglu.android.sync Contains the Sync API implementation for Android.
The Sync API is used to synchronize the data in your local SQLite tables with the AppGlu server.
 
 

Uses of SyncIntentServiceRequest in com.appglu.android.sync
 

Fields in com.appglu.android.sync with type parameters of type SyncIntentServiceRequest
static android.os.Parcelable.Creator<SyncIntentServiceRequest> SyncIntentServiceRequest.CREATOR
           
 

Methods in com.appglu.android.sync that return SyncIntentServiceRequest
static SyncIntentServiceRequest SyncIntentServiceRequest.applyChanges()
          Apply changes that were previously downloaded.
static SyncIntentServiceRequest SyncIntentServiceRequest.discardChanges()
          Discard changes that were previously downloaded.
static SyncIntentServiceRequest SyncIntentServiceRequest.downloadChanges()
          Requests changes from all of your SQLite tables to be downloaded only, but not applied.
If you also want files to be downlaoded use downloadChangesAndFiles().
static SyncIntentServiceRequest SyncIntentServiceRequest.downloadChangesAndFiles()
          Requests changes from all of your SQLite tables to be downloaded only, but not applied.
Will also download all files that are new or updated.
static SyncIntentServiceRequest SyncIntentServiceRequest.downloadChangesAndFilesForTables(List<String> tables)
          Requests changes from some of your SQLite tables to be downloaded only, but not applied.
Will also download all files that are new or updated.
static SyncIntentServiceRequest SyncIntentServiceRequest.downloadChangesAndFilesForTables(String... tables)
          Requests changes from some of your SQLite tables to be downloaded only, but not applied.
Will also download all files that are new or updated.
static SyncIntentServiceRequest SyncIntentServiceRequest.downloadChangesForTables(List<String> tables)
          Requests changes from some of your SQLite tables to be downloaded only, but not applied.
If you also want files to be downlaoded use downloadChangesAndFilesForTables(List).
static SyncIntentServiceRequest SyncIntentServiceRequest.downloadChangesForTables(String... tables)
          Requests changes from some of your SQLite tables to be downloaded only, but not applied.
If you also want files to be downlaoded use downloadChangesAndFilesForTables(String...).
static SyncIntentServiceRequest SyncIntentServiceRequest.syncDatabase()
          Download and apply changes from all of your SQLite tables.
If you also want files to be synchronized use syncDatabaseAndFiles().
static SyncIntentServiceRequest SyncIntentServiceRequest.syncDatabaseAndFiles()
          Download and apply changes from all of your SQLite tables.
Will also download and apply all files that are new or updated.
static SyncIntentServiceRequest SyncIntentServiceRequest.syncTables(List<String> tables)
          Download and apply changes from some of your SQLite tables.
If you also want files to be synchronized use syncTablesAndFiles(List).
static SyncIntentServiceRequest SyncIntentServiceRequest.syncTables(String... tables)
          Download and apply changes from some of your SQLite tables.
If you also want files to be synchronized use syncTablesAndFiles(String...).
static SyncIntentServiceRequest SyncIntentServiceRequest.syncTablesAndFiles(List<String> tables)
          Download and apply changes from some of your SQLite tables.
Will also download and apply all files that are new or updated.
static SyncIntentServiceRequest SyncIntentServiceRequest.syncTablesAndFiles(String... tables)
          Download and apply changes from some of your SQLite tables.
Will also download and apply all files that are new or updated.
 

Methods in com.appglu.android.sync with parameters of type SyncIntentServiceRequest
 void SyncApi.startSyncIntentService(SyncIntentServiceRequest request)
          Starts the Sync Service used to synchronize the data in your local SQLite tables with the AppGlu server.
Before calling this method you must make sure that SyncIntentService is declared on your AndroidManifest.xml.
